com.kuka.roboticsAPI.publishing.proxy.ncf
Class AbstractProxyBase

java.lang.Object
  com.kuka.roboticsAPI.publishing.proxy.ncf.AbstractProxyBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
IServiceProxy, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.Runnable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ServiceDirectoryClient
public abstract class AbstractProxyBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.io.Closeable, IServiceProxy

Base class for client implementations. Provides implementations for sending method messages to the server and getting the contract of the implemented interfaces.

Constructor Summary

subscribeForMethodResultChanges

protected long subscribeForMethodResultChanges(java.lang.String methodName,
                                               int interval,
                                               INotificationProxy notifyMethod,
                                               java.lang.Object... arguments)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Subscribes for method result changes. When the return value of a method call changes, a notification is sent to the client.

Parameters:
methodName - name of the method to observe
interval - interval for observing return value changes
arguments - arguments for the method call
notifyMethod - method to be called, when notification is received
Returns:
unique ID to identify the notification
Throws:
java.io.IOException - communication problem

sendSyncCommand

protected java.lang.Object sendSyncCommand(java.lang.String methodName,
                                           java.lang.Object... arguments)
                                    throws java.io.IOException
Sends a synchronous command message to the server. This server invokes a method on the corresponding service and returns the response to the client. The default timeout for receiving the response is used.

Parameters:
methodName - name of the method to invoke
arguments - arguments needed by the method
Returns:
the return value from the server
Throws:
java.io.IOException - communication problem

sendSyncCommandWithTimeout

protected java.lang.Object sendSyncCommandWithTimeout(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                      int timeout,
                                                      java.lang.Object... arguments)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
Sends a synchronous command message to the server. This server invokes a method on the corresponding service and returns the response to the client.

Parameters:
methodName - name of the method to invoke
timeout - timeout for receiving the response (in ms).
arguments - arguments needed by the method
Returns:
the return value from the server
Throws:
java.io.IOException - communication problem
CommandException - command fails, because \n- sending / receiving fails or \n- the method is not on the contract interface or \n-an exception was returned by the server

sendAsyncCommand

protected <T> CommandContainer<T> sendAsyncCommand(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                   java.lang.Object... arguments)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
Sends an asynchronous command message to the server. This server invokes a method on the corresponding service.

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the return value of the method to invoke
Parameters:
methodName - name of the method to invoke
arguments - arguments needed by the method
Returns:
container with details about the asynchronous command.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - communication problem
CommandException - command fails, because \n- sending / receiving fails or \n- the method is not on the contract interface or \n-an exception was returned by the server

activateNotifications

public void activateNotifications(long id)
Activates a notification on the client side. After this step the notifications are routed to the client.

Parameters:
id - id of the notification to enable

activateNotifications

public void activateNotifications(long id,
                                  boolean activate)
(De-)Activates a notification on the client side. After this step the notifications are routed to the client.

Parameters:
id - id of the notification to enable
activate - indicates whether receiving notifications should be activated or deactivated
